conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of the skydiver as a function of time. The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds. The y-axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s).
We are focusing on the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
From the graph, observe the velocity values between 0 and 10 seconds. The velocity increases from 0 m/s to 20 m/s over this interval.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. Since the velocity is increasing, the acceleration is positive.
Positive acceleration means the direction of acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity. Given that the skydiver is moving downward, the acceleration is also downward.
